WOUnit Framework 1.4 API

The WOUnit framework contains a set of utilities for testing WebObjects applications using JUnit 4.7 or later.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
com.wounit
This package contains some WOUnit utility classes.
com.wounit.annotations
This package contains annotations to be used in companion of the MockEditingContext or the TemporaryEditingContext rules.
com.wounit.exceptions
This package contains exception classes for errors in the WOUnit internal logic.
com.wounit.foundation  
com.wounit.matchers
This package contains the Matcher classes and the EOAssert class that works as an entry point to write unit test for Enterprise Object related logic.
com.wounit.rules
This package contains JUnit MethodRule implementations to be used while unit testing WebObjects applications.
com.wounit.utils  
The WOUnit framework contains a set of utilities for testing WebObjects applications using JUnit 4.7 or later.

Here is a simple test case written using WOUnit capabilities. 

import static com.wounit.EOAssert.*;
import com.wounit.rules.MockEditingContext;
import com.wounit.annotations.Dummy;
import com.wounit.annotations.UnderTest;

public class TestFoo {
   @Rule
   public MockEditingContext editingContext = new MockEditingContext("FooModel");

   @Dummy
   private Bar mockBar;

   @UnderTest
   private Foo foo;

   @Test
   public void cantSaveFooWithOnlyOneBar() {
      foo.addToBarRelationship(mockBar);

      confirm(foo, cannotBeSavedBecause("Foo must have at least 2 bars related to it"));
   }
}

Here is another test case written using WOUnit capabilities. 

import static com.wounit.EOAssert.*;
import com.wounit.rules.TemporaryEditingContext;
import com.wounit.annotations.UnderTest;

public class TestFoo {
   @Rule
   public TemporaryEditingContext editingContext = new TemporaryEditingContext("FooModel");

   @UnderTest
   private Foo foo;

   @Test
   public void cantSaveWithNullProperty() {
      foo.setBar(null);

      confirm(foo, cannotBeSavedBecause("The bar property cannot be null"));
   }
}

WOUnit can also be used in combination with Mockito for advanced testing. 

import static com.wounit.EOAssert.*;
import com.wounit.rules.MockEditingContext;
import com.wounit.annotations.UnderTest;
import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
import org.mockito.Spy;
import org.mockito.runners.MockitoJUnitRunner;

@RunWith(MockitoJUnitRunner.class)
public class TestFoo {
   @Rule
   public MockEditingContext editingContext = new MockEditingContext("FooModel");

   @Spy @UnderTest
   private Foo foo;

   @Test
   public void cantSaveWithNullProperty() {
      doReturn("text").when(foo).methodThatReturnString();
      ...
   }
}
